intro: Urostigma prinoides, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes stinging nettles, and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its stems are usually hairy and can have a mild stinging sensation when touched. Urostigma prinoides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
